required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 4-[18F]Fluoroglutamine PET/CT in Imaging Patients With Newly Diagnosed Lung Cancer or Indeterminate Pulmonary Nodules
clinical_study.official_title: [18F] 4-L-Fluoroglutamine (2S,4R) PET/CT in Imaging Patients With Newly Diagnosed Lung Cancer or Indeterminate Pulmonary Nodules

lead_sponsor.agency: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Institute of Materia Medica, Chinese Academy of Sciences

clinical_study.source: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial studies positron emission tomography (PET) imaging utilizing 18F-(2S,4R)4-fluoroglutamine, a glutamic acid derivative, to image patients with Newly Diagnosed Lung Cancer or Indeterminate Pulmonary Nodules. [18F]Fluoroglutamine PET may provide additional information that help diagnose lung cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnosing and Staging ability of 4-[18F]Fluoroglutamine PET/CT in lung cancer
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity, specificity, diagnostic accuracy of 4-[18F]Fluoroglutamine and 18F-FDG PET/CT will be compared using paired t-test or Krusal-Wallis test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days after the F-Gln imaging
secondary_outcome.description: The evaluation of the Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events starts from the day of F-Gln examination until 30 days later; Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events are evaluated according to version 4.03 CTC-AE criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: ASCT2 expression levels in tissue samples
secondary_outcome.description: Wilcoxon rank-sum or Kruskal-Wallis tests will be applied for the group comparisons of IHC staining(ASCT2)

arm_group.description: Patients undergo 18F-FDG PET/CT scan first. Within 7 working days, patients receive 4-[18F]Fluoroglutamine IV and 60 minutes after injection, undergo 4-[18F]Fluoroglutamine PET/CT before the start of therapy.

overall_official.affiliation: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
